descriptions: Student does not identify any nutrients.
Student identifies only one nutrient with inaccuracies.
Student identifies 2-3 nutrients but shows limited understanding.
Student identifies most major nutrients (e.g., carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals) but with some minor inaccuracies or omissions.
Student accurately identifies all major nutrients.
Student accurately identifies all major nutrients and some micronutrients (e.g., antioxidants, phytonutrients).
Student does not explain the function of any nutrient.
Student attempts to explain the function of at least one nutrient, but the explanation is unclear or incorrect.
Student explains the function of a few nutrients with limited detail.
Student explains the functions of most major nutrients, demonstrating a basic understanding.
Student explains the functions of major nutrients, demonstrating a clear understanding of their roles in the body.
Student comprehensively explains the functions of major nutrients and can describe how they work at a biochemical level.
Student does not make any connections between nutrients and health outcomes.
Student makes vague or inaccurate connections between nutrients and health.
Student identifies a few relationships between nutrients and health (e.g., vitamin C and immune function) but lacks detail.
Student explains how several nutrients impact health, providing some specific examples (e.g., calcium for bone health, fiber for digestive health).
Student clearly explains how various nutrients impact health, providing detailed examples and discussing both benefits and risks.
Student thoroughly explains the relationships between nutrients and health, including the impact on chronic diseases and personalized nutrition based on individual needs.
Student cannot apply knowledge to real-life scenarios.
Student struggles to apply knowledge of nutrients to real-life health choices.
Student can provide general examples of how to use nutrients for health but lacks detail.
Student provides practical examples of how to incorporate nutrients into a healthy diet.
Student can design a meal plan that meets specific nutritional needs.
Student can create comprehensive health recommendations based on nutritional science, considering individual dietary needs and health goals.
